statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -6 \\ 0 \\ -4 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -14 \\ 8 \\ -8 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -6 \\ 0 \\ -4 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -14 \\ 8 \\ -8 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
